column4: IF My problem With BusyBox13.3 Is unsolved Please Tell Me so i stop Searching ;) ;) ;)
you should be getting an error message when you're thrown into BusyBox - are you getting one?
Nops ;) No Error Just the initframs console
without more details about what's going on, there's not a lot of help anyone can provide - looks like you're aware of common reasons for getting put into BusyBox
this happened after a fsck ( with another linux distro in another partition
or maybe  disk check
can you provide more details about what you did? step-by-step?
I only work in the channel - sorry ;-)

i made an fsck or something that checks for disk sectors and all ... it was  going to take a very long time ... like it didn't want to stop checking sectors and all .. so i stopped it ! it was mainly for a problem with a colored screen when booting to the sgn in  (sometimes)
if you're multibooting (which is what it sounds like), can you boot into any of the other options?
(and for future reference - don't stop a fsck or similar process ;-) )
: i'm in a whole other partition but i can boot documents ( mount ) from the ubuntu disk
: say sorry from me to ubuntu :(:(
if I were you, I would boot into a live CD (or another Linux distro on your machine if you have one) and run fsck again (and let it finish)
: like fsck -l /dec/sda1
I would try 'e2fsck -f /dev/sda1' - assuming that /dev/sda1 is where Ubuntu lives
: i think i made this not working .. is their a solution for like making it with inframs ?
if your system is that borked, I would recommend backing up your data and reinstalling - it's probably faster and easier if you're fairly new to this
: Ok i'll make it ;) i don't need backups i just want a new OS ! Like for movies and all ;) How To reinstall (do i have to format from windows ? )
: what version of ubuntu do u suggesst ... 11.04 is a having a lot of problems !
I would suggest either 11.04 or 10.04
